metadata.title: CVE-2017-14997 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(excessive memory allocation) because of an integer underflow inReadPICTImage in coders/pict.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4').
